Temporary buoying of the channel to the Kadhama anchorage in Kuwait Bay. Sir, We have the honour to acknowledge receipt of your letter No,C-2 of the 2nd January 1936, dealing with the above quoted matt er. During the next three months we shall be receiving from ocean going steamers about 1600 tons of oil well drilling material which we wish to land at Has Kadhama. It will be advantageous to us if these steamers proceed into the inner portion of Kuwait Bay and anchor in the deep water within 4 miles of Has Kadhama, but the masters of the ships will not do this unless the channel and anchorage are demarcated by buoys. We therefore wish to obtain an estimate for the suitable temporary buoying of this channel and anchorage. We have now had an interview with Commander Gars ton. Port Officer of the Basrah Port Directorate and we have explained the position to him. We understand that Kuwait Bay does not come under the direct jurisdiction of the Basra Port Authorities and that it is therefore necessary for the local authorities here to approach the Port Directorate at Basra on our behalf. We take it that there would be no objection to such work being done and therefore request you to approach the Basra Port Directorate on our behalf firstly as to their willingness to hire the necessary buoys and place them forue and secondly for an estimate of the cost of the work and when it could be carried out. We understand that one of their vessels visits Kuwait periodically in connection with the maintenance of the buoys and lights at the Kuwait anchorage and that the work could be undertaken on one of these trips. #e would emphasise that for the present we only require the cheapest form of temporary demarcation as it is impossible for us to foresee at present to what extent we shall require to use the Ras Kadhama landing point after the completion of the shipments mentioned. As we are expecting our first eonsignment of material on or about the 25th instant we should be grateful if you would take up this matter for us immediately. We have the honour to be, Sir, Your obedient servants, sd. L.D.Scott, for Kuwait Oil Company,Ltd.Kuwait i Oil Company,Ltd. r/. physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the first folio with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 21; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence concerning the temporary buoying of the channel to the Ras Kadhama anchorage, at the western end of Kuwait Bay. The request was made by the Kuwait Oil Company, to enable them to land oil well drilling material, and the work was carried out by the Persian Gulf lights and buoys ship Nearchus, which was under the control of the Port Director and Director-General of Navigation, Basra.The file includes correspondence from the company, and an extract from a Kuwait intelligence summary, describing the company's pier at Ras Kadhama.The file includes a divider, which gives a list of correspondence references contained in the file by year. This is placed at the back of the correspondence.
